availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency
B. Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner would Respectfully represent that at the June Term 1861 -- of the Morgan Circuit Court he was tried and fined $50,00 for giveing liquor to a Slave. He represents that he gave the slave but one dram, and did not know at the time that it was a violation of the laws. he is not a vender of Ardent spirits. by Licence or otherwise but having bought a small quantity, the slave asked him for some and he gave him a dram, he is a poor man and not able to pay this fine, and hopes your excellency will remit it & he will ever pray &c
We the undersigned would respectfully Suggest to your Excellency the propriety of remiting the above fine.

Wm Mynheir
John W Kendall
F G
W W Cox
Wm Ware
J Barber
A J Parker
R. A. Sundys
J L Kendall

Morgan
Cir. Ct.
$50 } Giving liquor to a slave
Wm Walsh
